title: cellbender_remove_background_v0_2
description:
Eliminating technical artifacts from high-throughput single-cell RNA sequencing data.

This module removes counts due to ambient RNA molecules and random barcode swapping from (raw) UMI-based scRNA-seq count matrices. 
At the moment, only the count matrices produced by the CellRanger count pipeline is supported. Support for additional tools and protocols 
will be added in the future. A quick start tutorial can be found here.

Fleming et al. 2022, bioRxiv.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input h5mu file.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. List of modalities to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. List of modalities to process.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Full count matrix as an h5mu file, with background RNA removed
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Full count matrix as an h5mu file, with background RNA removed. This file contains all the original droplet barcodes.

expected_cells.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. Number of cells expected in the dataset (a rough estimate within a factor of 2 is sufficient)
expected_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. Number of cells expected in the dataset (a rough estimate within a factor of 2 is sufficient).

total_droplets_included.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `25000`. The number of droplets from the rank-ordered UMI plot
that will be analyzed
total_droplets_included.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `25000`. The number of droplets from the rank-ordered UMI plot
that will be analyzed. The largest 'total_droplets'
droplets will have their cell probabilities inferred
as an output.

expected_cells_from_qc.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Will use the Cell Ranger QC to determine the estimated number of cells
expected_cells_from_qc.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Will use the Cell Ranger QC to determine the estimated number of cells

model.description: Type: `string`, default: `full`, choices: ``simple`, `ambient`, `swapping`, `full``. Which model is being used for count data
model.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `full`, choices: ``simple`, `ambient`, `swapping`, `full``. Which model is being used for count data. 'simple'
does not model either ambient RNA or random barcode
swapping (for debugging purposes -- not recommended).
'ambient' assumes background RNA is incorporated into
droplets. 'swapping' assumes background RNA comes from
random barcode swapping. 'full' uses a combined
ambient and swapping model.

epochs.description: Type: `integer`, default: `150`. Number of epochs to train
epochs.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `150`. Number of epochs to train.

low_count_threshold.description:
Type: `integer`, default: `15`. Droplets with UMI counts below this number are completely 
excluded from the analysis
low_count_threshold.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `15`. Droplets with UMI counts below this number are completely 
excluded from the analysis. This can help identify the correct 
prior for empty droplet counts in the rare case where empty 
counts are extremely high (over 200).

z_dim.description: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. Dimension of latent variable z
z_dim.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. Dimension of latent variable z.

z_layers.description: Type: List of `integer`, default: `500`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Dimension of hidden layers in the encoder for z
z_layers.help_text: Type: List of `integer`, default: `500`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Dimension of hidden layers in the encoder for z.

training_fraction.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.9`. Training detail: the fraction of the data used for training
training_fraction.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `0.9`. Training detail: the fraction of the data used for training.
The rest is never seen by the inference algorithm. Speeds up learning.

empty_drop_training_fraction.description:
Type: `double`, default: `0.5`. Training detail: the fraction of the training data each epoch that 
is drawn (randomly sampled) from surely empty droplets
empty_drop_training_fraction.help_text:
Type: `double`, default: `0.5`. Training detail: the fraction of the training data each epoch that 
is drawn (randomly sampled) from surely empty droplets.

fpr.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `0.01`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Target false positive rate in (0, 1)
fpr.help_text:
Type: List of `double`, default: `0.01`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Target false positive rate in (0, 1). A false positive
is a true signal count that is erroneously removed.
More background removal is accompanied by more signal
removal at high values of FPR. You can specify
multiple values, which will create multiple output
files.

exclude_antibody_capture.description:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Including the flag --exclude-antibody-capture will
cause remove-background to operate on gene counts
only, ignoring other features
exclude_antibody_capture.help_text:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Including the flag --exclude-antibody-capture will
cause remove-background to operate on gene counts
only, ignoring other features.

learning_rate.description: Type: `double`, example: `1.0E-4`. Training detail: lower learning rate for inference
learning_rate.help_text:
Type: `double`, example: `1.0E-4`. Training detail: lower learning rate for inference. A
OneCycle learning rate schedule is used, where the
upper learning rate is ten times this value. (For this
value, probably do not exceed 1e-3).

cuda.description:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Including the flag --cuda will run the inference on a
GPU
cuda.help_text:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Including the flag --cuda will run the inference on a
GPU.

nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
